<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The weighted-average grant-date exercise price of options granted during 2015 and 2014 was $154.58 and $121.00,
	respectively. The aggregate intrinsic values of options exercised during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 were $22,571,000, $7,318,000 and $9,709,000, respectively, and were based on the closing prices of the Corporation&#146;s
	common stock on the dates of exercise. The aggregate intrinsic values for options outstanding and exercisable at December&nbsp;31, 2016 were $52,189,000 and $45,138,000, respectively, and were based on the closing price of the Corporation&#146;s
	common stock at December&nbsp;31, 2016, which was $221.53.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, there are approximately 941,000 awards available for grant
	under the Plans. In 2016, the Corporation&#146;s shareholders approved the registration of an additional 800,000 shares of common stock under the Plans. As part of approving
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	the registered shares, the Corporation agreed to not issue any additional awards under the legacy TXI plan. The awards available for grant under the Plans at December&nbsp;31, 2016 reflect no
	awards available under the legacy TXI plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 1996, the Corporation adopted the Shareholder Value Achievement Plan to award shares of the
	Corporation&#146;s common stock to key senior employees based on certain common stock performance criteria over a long-term period. Under the terms of this plan, 250,000 shares of common stock were reserved for issuance. Through December&nbsp;31,
	2016, 42,025 shares have been issued under this plan. No awards have been granted under this plan after 2000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation adopted and the
	shareholders approved the Common Stock Purchase Plan for Directors in 1996, which provides nonemployee Board of Directors the election to receive all or a portion of their total fees in the form of the Corporation&#146;s common stock. In 2016,
	members of the Board of Directors were not required to defer any of their fees in the form of the Corporation&#146;s common stock. Under the terms of this plan, 300,000 shares of common stock were reserved for issuance. Nonemployee Board of
	Directors elected to defer portions of their fees representing 3,699, 4,035 and 3,804 shares of the Corporation&#146;s common stock under this plan during 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table summarizes stock-based compensation expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, unrecognized compensation
	cost for nonvested awards at December&nbsp;31, 2016 and the weighted-average period over which unrecognized compensation cost will be recognized:
</P>

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Corporation recognized a deferred tax
	asset related to stock-based compensation expense of $7,901,000, $5,286,000 and $3,542,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	stock-based compensation expense in future periods for outstanding awards as of December&nbsp;31, 2016:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Stock-based compensation expense is included in selling, general and administrative expenses in the Corporation&#146;s
	consolidated statements of earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Note L: Leases
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Total lease expense for operating leases was $85,945,000, $80,417,000 and $59,590,000 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively. The Corporation&#146;s operating leases generally contain renewal and/or purchase options with varying terms. The Corporation has royalty agreements that generally require royalty payments based on tons produced or total sales dollars
	and also contain minimum payments. Total royalties, principally for leased properties, were $55,257,000, $53,658,000 and $50,535,000 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Corporation also has capital lease
	obligations for machinery and equipment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Future minimum lease and royalty commitments for all
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cancelable
</FONT>
	agreements and capital lease obligations as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 are as follows:

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Long-term capital lease obligations
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	$
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	12,922&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Of the total future minimum commitments, $225,900,000 relates to the Corporation&#146;s contracts of
	affreightment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Note M: Shareholders&#146; Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The authorized capital structure of the Corporation includes 100,000,000 shares of common stock, with a par value of $0.01 a share. At December&nbsp;31,
	2016, approximately 2,164,000 common shares were reserved for issuance under stock-based plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to authority granted by its Board of
	Directors, the Corporation can repurchase up to 20,000,000 shares of common stock through open-market purchases. The Corporation repurchased 1,587,987 and 3,285,380 shares of common stock during 2016 and 2015, respectively, and did not repurchase
	any shares of common stock during 2014. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, 15,126,633 shares of common stock were remaining under the Corporation&#146;s repurchase authorization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition to common stock, the Corporation&#146;s capital structure includes 10,000,000 shares of preferred stock with a par value of $0.01 a share.
	On October&nbsp;21, 2006, the Board of Directors adopted a Rights Agreement (the &#147;Rights Agreement&#148;) and reserved 200,000 shares of Junior Participating Class&nbsp;B Preferred Stock for issuance. In accordance with the Rights Agreement,
	the Corporation issued a dividend of one right for each share of the Corporation&#146;s common stock outstanding as of October&nbsp;21, 2006, and one right continues to attach to each share of common stock issued thereafter. The rights will become
	exercisable if any person or group acquires beneficial ownership of 15% or more of the Corporation&#146;s common stock. Once exercisable and upon a person or group acquiring 15% or more of the Corporation&#146;s common stock, each right (other than
	rights owned by such person or group) entitles its holder to purchase, for an exercise price of $315 per share, a number of shares of the Corporation&#146;s common stock (or in certain circumstances, cash, property or other securities of the
	Corporation) having a market value of twice the exercise price, and under certain conditions, common stock of an acquiring company having a market value of twice the exercise price. If any person or group acquires beneficial ownership of 15% or more
	of the Corporation&#146;s common stock, the Corporation may, at its option, exchange the outstanding rights (other than rights owned by such acquiring person or group) for shares of the Corporation&#146;s common stock or Corporation equity
	securities deemed to have the same value as one share of common stock or a combination thereof, at an exchange ratio of one share of common stock per right. The Corporation&#146;s Rights Agreement expired on October&nbsp;21, 2016.
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Note N: Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Legal and Administrative Proceedings.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Corporation is engaged in certain legal and administrative proceedings incidental to its normal business activities. In the opinion of management and counsel, based upon currently-available facts, it is remote that the ultimate outcome of any
	litigation and other proceedings, including those pertaining to environmental matters (see Note A), relating to the Corporation and its subsidiaries, will have a material adverse effect on the overall results of the Corporation&#146;s operations,
	its cash flows or its financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Asset Retirement
	Obligations.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Corporation incurs reclamation and teardown costs as part of its mining and production processes. Estimated future obligations are discounted to their present value and accreted to
	their projected future obligations via charges to operating expenses. Additionally, the fixed assets recorded concurrently with the liabilities are depreciated over the period until retirement activities are expected to occur. Total accretion and
	depreciation expenses for 2016, 2015 and 2014 were $8,823,000, $6,767,000 and $4,584,000, respectively, and are included in other operating income and expenses, net, in the consolidated statements of earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following shows the changes in the asset retirement obligations:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Other Environmental Matters.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Corporation&#146;s operations are subject to and affected by federal, state and local laws and regulations relating to the environment, health and safety and other regulatory matters. Certain of the Corporation&#146;s
	operations may, from time to time, involve the use of substances that are classified as toxic or hazardous within the meaning of these laws and regulations. Environmental operating permits are, or may be, required for certain of the
	Corporation&#146;s operations, and such permits are subject to modification, renewal and revocation. The Corporation regularly monitors and reviews its operations, procedures and policies for compliance with these laws and regulations. Despite these
	compliance efforts, risk of environmental remediation liability is inherent in the operation
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	of the Corporation&#146;s businesses, as it is with other companies engaged in similar businesses. The Corporation has no material provisions for environmental remediation liabilities and does
	not believe such liabilities will have a material adverse effect on the Corporation in the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The United States Environmental Protection
	Agency (&#147;EPA&#148;) includes the lime industry as a national enforcement priority under the federal Clean Air Act (&#147;CAA&#148;). As part of the industry-wide effort, the EPA issued Notices of Violation/ Findings of Violation
	(&#147;NOVs&#148;) to the Corporation in 2010 and 2011 regarding its compliance with the CAA New Source Review (&#147;NSR&#148;) program at its Magnesia Specialties dolomitic lime manufacturing plant in Woodville, Ohio. The Corporation has been
	providing information to the EPA in response to these NOVs and has had several meetings with the EPA. The Corporation believes it is in substantial compliance with the NSR program. At this time, the Corporation cannot reasonably estimate what likely
	penalties or upgrades to equipment might ultimately be required. The Corporation believes any costs related to any required upgrades to capital equipment will be spread over time and will not have a material adverse effect on the Corporation&#146;s
	results of operations or its financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Insurance Reserves.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Corporation has insurance coverage with large deductibles for workers&#146; compensation, automobile liability, marine liability and general liability claims. The Corporation is also self-insured for health claims. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, reserves of $42,184,000 and $45,911,000, respectively, were recorded for all such insurance claims. The Corporation carries various risk deductible workers&#146; compensation policies related to its workers&#146;
	compensation liabilities. The Corporation records the workers&#146; compensation reserves based on an actuarial-determined analysis. This analysis calculates development factors, which are applied to total reserves within the workers&#146;
	compensation program. While the Corporation believes the assumptions used to calculate these liabilities are appropriate, significant differences in actual experience and/or significant changes in these assumptions may materially affect
	workers&#146; compensation costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Letters of Credit.
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the normal course of business, the Corporation provides certain third parties with standby letter of credit agreements guaranteeing its payment for certain insurance claims, utilities and property improvements. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Corporation was contingently liable for $45,428,000 in letters of credit, of which $2,507,000 were issued under the Corporation&#146;s Revolving Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	Martin
	Marietta&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Certain of these underlying obligations are accrued on the Corporation&#146;s consolidated balance
	sheets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Surety Bonds.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In the normal course of
	business, at December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Corporation was contingently liable for $381,456,000 in surety bonds required by certain states and municipalities and their related agencies. The bonds are principally for certain insurance claims,
	construction contracts, reclamation obligations and mining permits guaranteeing the Corporation&#146;s own performance. Certain of these underlying obligations, including those for asset retirement requirements and insurance claims, are accrued on
	the Corporation&#146;s consolidated balance sheets. Five of these bonds total $85,111,000, or 22%, of all outstanding surety bonds. The Corporation has indemnified the underwriting insurance companies, Liberty Mutual and W.R. Berkley, against any
	exposure under the surety bonds. In the Corporation&#146;s past experience, no material claims have been made against these financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Borrowing Arrangements with Affiliate.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Corporation is a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-borrower
</FONT>
	with an unconsolidated affiliate for a $25,000,000 revolving line of credit agreement with BB&amp;T, of which $22,600,000 was outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. The line of
	credit expires in February 2018. The affiliate has agreed to reimburse and indemnify the Corporation for any payments and expenses the Corporation may incur from this agreement. The Corporation holds a lien on the affiliate&#146;s membership
	interest in a joint venture as collateral for payment under the revolving line of credit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2014, the Corporation loaned the
	unconsolidated affiliate a total of $6,000,000 as an interest-only note due December&nbsp;31, 2019.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Purchase Commitments.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Corporation had purchase
	commitments for property, plant and equipment of $94,074,000 as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. The Corporation also had other purchase obligations related to energy and service contracts of $106,307,000 as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. The
	Corporation&#146;s contractual purchase commitments as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Capital expenditures in 2016, 2015 and 2014 that were purchase commitments as of the prior year end were
	$62,927,000, $116,681,000 and $34,135,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Employees.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Approximately 11% of the Corporation&#146;s employees are represented by a labor union. All such employees are hourly employees. The Corporation maintains collective bargaining agreements relating to the union employees
	within the Aggregates business and Magnesia Specialties segment. Of the Magnesia Specialties segment, located in Manistee, Michigan and Woodville, Ohio, 100% of its hourly employees are represented by labor unions. The Manistee collective bargaining
	agreement expires in August 2019. The Woodville collective bargaining agreement expires in May 2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Note O: Business Segments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Aggregates business is comprised of divisions which represent operating segments. Disclosures for certain divisions are consolidated
	as reportable segments for financial reporting purposes as they meet the aggregation criteria. The Aggregates business contains three reportable segments:
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Mid-America
</FONT>
	Group, Southeast Group and West Group. The
	Cement and Magnesia Specialties businesses also represent individual operating and reportable segments. The accounting policies used for segment reporting are the same as those described in Note A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation&#146;s evaluation of performance and allocation of resources are based primarily on earnings from operations. Consolidated earnings
	from operations include net sales less cost of sales, selling, general and administrative expenses, acquisition-related expenses, net, and other operating income and expenses, net, and exclude interest expense, other nonoperating income and
	expenses, net, and taxes on income. Corporate consolidated earnings from operations primarily include depreciation on capitalized interest, expenses for corporate administrative functions, acquisition-related expenses, net, and other nonrecurring
	and/or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-operational
</FONT>
	income and expenses excluded from the Corporation&#146;s evaluation of business segment performance and resource allocation. All debt and related interest expense is held at Corporate.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Assets employed by segment include assets directly identified with those operations. Corporate assets
	consist primarily of cash and cash equivalents; property, plant and equipment for corporate operations; investments and other assets not directly identifiable with a reportable business segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Corporation changed the presentation of the elimination of the intersegment and interproduct revenues
	and sales. Information for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 has been conformed to the 2016 presentation.
</P>

	display selected financial data for the Corporation&#146;s reportable business segments.
</P>

	&nbsp;

	Intersegment revenues and intersegment sales
	represent Cement business sales to the West Group&#146;s ready mixed concrete business.

<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="12">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:16PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Aggregates business includes the aggregates
	product line and aggregates-related downstream product lines, which include the asphalt/paving and ready mixed concrete product lines. All aggregates-related downstream product lines reside in the West Group. The following tables, which are
	reconciled to consolidated amounts, provide total revenues, net sales and gross profit by line of business: Aggregates (further divided by product line), Cement and Magnesia Specialties. Interproduct revenues and interproduct sales represent sales
	from the aggregates product line to the asphalt/paving and ready mixed concrete product lines. Intersegment revenues and intersegment sales represent cement product line sales to the ready mixed concrete product line.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:16PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" COLOR="#0085CD">
	(continued)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The changes in accrued salaries, benefits and payroll taxes reflect an increase in accrued incentive
	compensation in 2016,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	TXI-related
</FONT>
	severance payments of $9,682,000 in 2015 and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	TXI-related
</FONT>
	severance accrual of $11,444,000 in 2014. The changes in accrued income taxes
	reflects the utilization of deferred tax assets related to the AMT credit carryforward in 2016 and NOL carryforwards in 2016 and 2015. Additionally, in 2015, the Corporation received the federal tax refunds attributable to the settlement of the U.S.
	Advanced Pricing Agreement. The change in accrued pension, postretirement and postemployment benefits in 2015 was attributable to higher pension plan funding, which increased $28,270,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Noncash investing and financing activities are as follows:
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION&nbsp;&amp; ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL
	CONDITION&nbsp;&amp; RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	INTRODUCTORY OVERVIEW
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Martin Marietta Materials, Inc. (the &#147;Corporation&#148; or &#147;Martin Marietta&#148;) is a leading supplier of aggregates products (crushed
	stone, sand and gravel) used in the construction of infrastructure, nonresidential and residential projects. Aggregates products are also used for railroad ballast and in agricultural, utility and environmental applications. In addition, the
	Corporation is a leading supplier of cement, ready mixed concrete and asphalt and paving services in some regions where being able to supply a full range of products is important for customer service. The Corporation also has a Magnesia Specialties
	business which produces magnesia-based chemicals products, used in industrial, agricultural and environmental applications, and dolomitic lime, which is sold primarily to customers in the steel industry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation&#146;s consolidated net sales and operating earnings are predominately derived from its Aggregates business, which mines and processes
	granite, limestone, sand and gravel. The Aggregates business includes aggregates-related downstream operations, namely heavy building materials such as ready mixed concrete, asphalt and road paving construction services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation&#146;s primary objective is to maximize long-term shareholder return by remaining disciplined in the pursuit of strategic growth and
	earnings objectives. Management executes its commitment to this overarching goal through the Corporation&#146;s core foundational pillars as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Safety &#150; protecting the well-being of all who come in contact with the Corporation&#146;s business and achieving
	world-class safety measures
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Ethics &#150; conducting business in compliance with applicable laws, rules, regulations and the highest ethical values
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	Sustainability &#150; reflecting all aspects of good corporate citizenship by being responsible neighbors and
	supporting local communities; and protecting the Earth&#146;s resources and minimizing the operations&#146; environmental impact
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	advantages and committing to its core competencies
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Customer Satisfaction &#150; maintaining positive customer relationships and being selected as the supplier of choice
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Consolidated Strategic Objectives
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation views its strategic objectives through the lens of building on the foundation of a world-class organization. Consistent with this
	premise, the Corporation&#146;s Board of Directors and management continue to assess business combinations and arrangements with other companies engaged in similar or complementary businesses that increase the Corporation&#146;s presence in its
	strategic businesses or provide new opportunities in markets that the Corporation views as attractive. In the opinion of management, attractive aggregates markets exhibit population growth or population density, drivers of construction materials
	consumption and large-scale infrastructure networks; business and employment diversity, a driver of greater economic stability; and superior state financial position, a driver of public infrastructure growth. With further economic recovery,
	management anticipates the number of acquisition opportunities should increase as sellers view options for monetizing improving earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In light
	of these objectives, management intends to emphasize, among other things, the following strategic, financial and operational initiatives in 2017:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Strategic:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">

	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Pursuing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	aggregates-led
</FONT>
	expansion through acquisitions that complement existing
	operations (i.e.,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	bolt-on
</FONT>
	acquisitions) and acquisitions that provide leadership positions in new markets or similar product lines (i.e., platform acquisitions)
</P>
</TD>

	Maintaining the incremental gross margin (excluding freight and delivery revenues) of the aggregates product line at
	management&#146;s targeted goal of an average of 60% over the course of recovery in the business cycle, including recovery in the southeastern U.S. markets
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">

</FONT>
</TD>

</TD>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Maximizing return on invested capital consistent with the successful long-term operation of the Corporation&#146;s
	business
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	additions was $387.3&nbsp;million; capital plan focused on maintaining safe, environmentally-sound operations and increasing operating efficiencies along with a continuing investment in land with long-term mineral reserves to serve high-growth
	markets

</TR>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="14">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="13" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	-
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Committed to employee well-being by providing first-class benefits, including, but not limited to, employee disaster
	relief assistance, education assistance
<B>
</B>
	and scholarships
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Completed two strategic acquisitions:
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="14">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="13" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	-
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Rocky Mountain Materials &#150; expanded the Corporation&#146;s position along the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains;
	provided more than 500&nbsp;million tons of high-quality aggregates reserves
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="14">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="13" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	-
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Ratliff Ready Mix &#150; buyout of remaining interest in ready mixed concrete company that serves the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	I-35
</FONT>
	corridor between Dallas and Austin; enhanced market position and provided additional vertical integration benefits with existing cement business
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Aggregates Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016,
	the Aggregates business shipped 158.6&nbsp;million tons of aggregates from a network of nearly 300 aggregates quarries and distribution yards in 26 states, Canada and the Bahamas. These shipments included 10.4&nbsp;million tons consumed by the
	business&#146; aggregates-related downstream operations. The Corporation also shipped 8.5&nbsp;million cubic yards of ready mixed concrete from approximately 150 plants primarily located in the high-growth states of Texas and Colorado. The asphalt
	operations shipped 1.0&nbsp;million tons of asphalt and additionally used 2.1&nbsp;million tons of asphalt in the Aggregates business&#146; paving operations. While the Aggregates business covers a wide geographic
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	Martin
	Marietta&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#0085CD">
	Page 42
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION &amp; ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION &amp; RESULTS OF
	OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
	(continued)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	area, financial results depend on the strength of the local economies because of the cost of transportation relative to the price of the products. The Aggregates business&#146; top five
	sales-generating states &#150; Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, Iowa and Georgia &#150; accounted for 73% of its 2016 net sales by state of destination, while the top ten sales-generating states accounted for 87% of its 2016 net sales. Management
	closely monitors economic conditions and public infrastructure spending in the market areas in the states where the Corporation&#146;s operations are located. Further, supply and demand conditions in these states affect their respective
	profitability.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Aggregates business was organized as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/24/0001193125-17-056282_G344578EX13PG37ANEW2.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">
	Quarries, Plants and Distribution Facilities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT" BGCOLOR="#CEDFDF">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">
<B>
	Modes of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">
<B>
	Transportation&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">
<B>
	for&nbsp;Aggregates&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">

	&nbsp;

	Truck and&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	Truck,&nbsp;Rail&nbsp;and&nbsp;
</FONT>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<FONT COLOR="#3B3B57">
	Truck and Rail
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The construction aggregates industry is a mature, cyclical business dependent on activity within the
	construction marketplace. In 2016, the Corporation&#146;s aggregates product line shipments increased 1.4% compared with 2015. The Corporation&#146;s aggregates product line shipments have increased each of the past five years, reflecting degrees of
	stability and modest growth. However, aggregates volumes are still below historically normal levels. Prior to 2011, the economic recession resulted in United States aggregates consumption declining by almost 40% from peak volumes in 2006.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
<I>
	Aggregates Product Line
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As mentioned earlier, the principal
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	end-use
</FONT>
	markets of the aggregates industry are public infrastructure (i.e.,
	highways; streets; roads; bridges; and schools); nonresidential construction (i.e., manufacturing and distribution facilities; industrial complexes; office buildings; large retailers and wholesalers; and malls); and residential construction (i.e.,
	subdivision development; and single- and multi-family housing). Aggregates products are also used in the railroad, agricultural, utility and environmental industries. Ballast is an aggregates product used to stabilize railroad track beds and,
	increasingly, concrete rail ties are being used as a substitute for wooden ties. Agricultural lime, a high-calcium carbonate material, is used as a supplement in animal feed, a soil acidity neutralizer and agricultural growth enhancer. High-calcium
	limestone is used as filler in glass, plastic, paint, rubber, adhesives, grease and paper. Chemical-grade, high-calcium limestone is used as a desulfurization material in utility plants. Stone is used as a stabilizing material to control erosion
	caused by water runoff or at ocean beaches, inlets, rivers and streams. The following presents the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	end-use
</FONT>
	distribution of aggregates product line shipments:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/24/0001193125-17-056282_G344578EX13PG37BNEW3.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

	10%
</FONT>
</TD>

</B>

</I>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Martin
	Marietta&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#0085CD">
	Page 43
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION &amp; ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION &amp; RESULTS OF
	OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
	(continued)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	End-use
</FONT>
	markets respond to changing economic conditions in
	different ways. Public infrastructure construction has historically been more stable than nonresidential and residential construction due to typically stable and predictable funding from federal, state and local governments, with approximately half
	from the federal government and half from state and local governments. However, after uncertainty regarding the solvency of the Highway Bill in 2014, the Corporation experienced a slight retraction in aggregates shipments to the infrastructure
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	end-use
</FONT>
	market. After a decade of 36 short-term funding provisions, a five-year, $305&nbsp;billion highway bill,
<I>
	Fixing America&#146;s Surface Transportation Act
</I>
	(&#147;FAST Act&#148; or &#147;Act&#148;), was
	signed into law on December&nbsp;4, 2015. Funding for the FAST Act will primarily be secured through gas tax collections and will enable states to purchase and use an estimated additional 114&nbsp;million tons of aggregates over the life of the Act.
	Over the past 24 months, many states have taken on a significantly larger role in funding infrastructure investment, including initiating special-purpose taxes and raising gas taxes. Overall, the infrastructure market accounted for 39% of the
	Corporation&#146;s 2016 aggregates product line shipments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Nonresidential and residential construction levels are interest rate-sensitive and
	typically move in direct correlation with economic cycles. The Dodge Momentum Index, a twelve-month leading indicator of construction spending for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-residential
</FONT>
	building compiled by McGraw Hill Construction
	and where the year 2000 serves as an index basis of 100, remained strong and was at an eight-year high of 136.7 in December 2016, a 9% increase over prior year, signaling continued growth in nonresidential construction. Housing starts, a key
	indicator for residential construction activity, continued to show year-over-year improvement. While starts exceeded one million in 2016, they still remain below the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	50-year
</FONT>
	historical annual average of
	1.5&nbsp;million units. That said, the Corporation expects to continue to experience gains in the residential market. Importantly, 2016 housing starts exceeded completions, a trend expected to continue in 2017.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
<I>
	Aggregates-Related Downstream Businesses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The aggregates-related downstream businesses, which include ready mixed concrete and asphalt and paving operations, have inherently lower gross margins
	(excluding freight and delivery revenues) than the aggregates product line. Market dynamics for these operations include a highly competitive environment and lower barriers to entry. Liquid asphalt, or bitumen, and cement are key raw materials in
	the production of hot mix asphalt and ready mixed concrete, respectively. Therefore, fluctuations in prices for these raw materials directly affect the Corporation&#146;s operating results. Liquid asphalt prices in 2016 were lower than in 2015, but
	may not always follow other energy products (e.g., oil or diesel fuel) because of complexities in the refining process which converts a barrel of oil into other fuels and petrochemical products. Shipments of aggregates-related downstream products
	typically follow construction aggregates trends.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Cement Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Cement business includes a leading position in the Texas cement markets, with production facilities in Midlothian, Texas, south of Dallas-Fort
	Worth, and Hunter, Texas, north of San Antonio. These plants produce Portland and specialty cements and have a combined annual capacity of 4.5&nbsp;million tons, as well as a current permit that provides an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	800,000-ton-expansion
</FONT>
</FONT>
	opportunity at the Midlothian plant. In addition to the production facilities, the Corporation operates several cement distribution terminals. The Corporation owns more than
	600&nbsp;million tons of limestone reserves adjacent to its cement production plants. Calcium carbonate in the form of limestone is the principal raw material used in the production of cement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Similar to the Aggregates business, cement is used in infrastructure projects; nonresidential and residential construction; and railroad, aggregates,
	utility and environmental industries. Further, cement is the basic binding agent for concrete, a primary construction material. Consequently, the cement industry is cyclical and dependent on the strength of the construction sector. In 2016, the
	Corporation shipped 3.5&nbsp;million tons of cement, consisting of 2.3&nbsp;million tons to external customers in five states and 1.2&nbsp;million tons for internal use. The Portland Cement Association (&#147;PCA&#148;) forecasts a 3% increase in
	demand in Texas in 2017 over
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	Martin
	Marietta&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#0085CD">
	Page 44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION &amp; ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION &amp; RESULTS OF
	OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
	(continued)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	2016. The Cement business&#146; leadership, in collaboration with the aggregates and ready mixed concrete teams, have developed strategic plans regarding interplant efficiencies, as well as
	tactical plans addressing plant utilization and efficiency. In 2016, the cement plants operated on average at 76% utilization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Energy, including
	electricity and fossil fuels, accounts for 22% of the cement production cost profile. Therefore, profitability of the Cement business is affected by changes in energy prices and the available supply of these products. The Corporation currently has
	fixed-price supply contracts for coal but also consumes natural gas, diesel and alternative fuels and petroleum coke. Further, profitability of the Cement business is also subject to kiln maintenance. This process typically requires a plant to be
	shut down for a period of time as repairs are made. In 2016, the Cement business incurred kiln maintenance costs of $20.9&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Magnesia Specialties Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Magnesia Specialties business produces and sells dolomitic lime from its Woodville, Ohio facility and magnesia-based chemicals from its Manistee,
	Michigan facility. In 2016, this business achieved record net sales, gross profit and earnings from operations of $238.0&nbsp;million, $89.5&nbsp;million and $79.1&nbsp;million, respectively. The dolomitic lime business, which represented 30% of
	Magnesia Specialties&#146; 2016 net sales, is dependent on the steel industry and operating results are affected by cyclical changes in that industry. The dolomitic lime business runs most profitably at 70% or greater steel capacity utilization;
	domestic capacity utilization averaged 71% in 2016. The chemical products business focuses on higher-margin specialty chemicals that can be produced at volumes that support efficient operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A significant portion of costs related to the production of dolomitic lime and magnesia chemical products is of a fixed or semi-fixed nature. The
	production of dolomitic lime and certain magnesia chemical products also requires the use of natural gas, coal and petroleum coke. Therefore, fluctuations in their pricing directly affect operating results. The Corporation has fixed-price supply
	contracts for natural gas, coal and petroleum coke to help mitigate this risk. For 2016, the Corporation&#146;s average cost per MCF (thousand cubic feet) for natural gas decreased 25% from 2015.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Liquidity and Capital Allocation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation&#146;s cash flows are generated primarily from operations. Operating cash flows generally fund working capital needs, capital
	expenditures, dividends, share repurchases and smaller acquisitions. The Corporation has capital allocation priorities in the following order:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Acquisitions &#150; execution of strategic growth plan
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Organic capital investment &#150; above-maintenance level of capital spending expected over next five years
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Return of cash to shareholders:
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="12">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;-
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Dividends &#150; increased quarterly cash dividend 5% to $0.42 in August 2016
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="12">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;-
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT">
	Share repurchases &#150; initial authorization of 20.0&nbsp;million shares; 15.1&nbsp;million shares remaining
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During 2016, the Corporation generated operating cash flow of $679&nbsp;million. Significant uses of cash during the year
	included $387&nbsp;million for capital expenditures (additions for the year were $404 million), $179&nbsp;million for acquisitions, $105&nbsp;million for dividends, $259&nbsp;million for repurchases of the Corporation&#146;s common stock and
	$45&nbsp;million for pension plan contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Cash and cash equivalents on hand of $50&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2016, along with the
	Corporation&#146;s projected internal cash flows and its available financing resources, including access to debt and equity markets, as needed, is expected to continue to be sufficient to provide the capital resources necessary to support
	anticipated operating needs, cover debt service requirements, satisfy
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cancelable
</FONT>
	agreements, meet capital expenditures and discretionary investment needs, fund certain acquisition opportunities that may
	arise and allow for payment of dividends for the foreseeable future. The Corporation has a $300&nbsp;million trade receivable securitization facility (the &#147;Trade Receivable Facility&#148;). The Corporation also has a $700&nbsp;million five-year
	senior unsecured revolving facility (the &#147;Revolving Facility&#148;) with a syndicate of banks. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Corporation had combined unused borrowing capacity of $658&nbsp;million under the Trade Receivable Facility and
	Revolving Facility.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#0085CD" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT COLOR="#FFFFFF">
	FINANCIAL OVERVIEW
</FONT>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CDDEE7" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Highlights of 2016 Financial Performance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(all comparisons are versus 2015)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CDDEE7" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:4PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>

</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0085CD">
<B>
	Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The discussion and analysis that follow reflect management&#146;s assessment of the financial condition and results of operations of the Corporation and
	should be read in conjunction with the audited consolidated financial statements on pages 10 through 40. As discussed in more detail herein, the Corporation&#146;s operating results are highly dependent upon activity within the construction
	marketplace, economic cycles within the public and private business sectors and seasonal and other weather-related conditions. In 2016 and 2015, many areas in the United States experienced significant amounts of precipitation. In fact, in 2015,
	Texas and Oklahoma each had its wettest year and the nation as a whole had its third wettest year in National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration&#146;s (&#147;NOAA&#148;) recorded history of 122 years. Net sales, production and cost structure
	were adversely affected by the significant precipitation. In 2016, Texas experienced more heavy rainfall, with the year ranking the 18th wettest year in the state&#146;s recorded history per NOAA. Further, since March 2015, Texas and surrounding
	regions have experienced 18 major flood events. Accordingly, the financial results for any year, notably 2016 and 2015, or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-to-year
</FONT>
</FONT>
	comparisons of reported results,
	may not be indicative of future operating results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Corporation&#146;s Aggregates business generated the majority of consolidated net sales and
	consolidated operating earnings. Furthermore, management presents certain key performance indicators for the Aggregates business. The following comparative analysis and discussion should be read within these contexts. Further, sensitivity analysis
	and certain other data are provided to enhance the reader&#146;s understanding of Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations and are not intended to be indicative of management&#146;s judgment of
	materiality.
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

	Martin

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:4PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:7PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	1
</SUP>
	2014 results reflect six months of TXI operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:16PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The comparative analysis in this Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
	Results of Operations is based on net sales and cost of sales. However, gross margin as a percentage of net sales represents a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	measure. The Corporation presents this ratio based on net sales, as it is
	consistent with the basis by which management reviews the Corporation&#146;s operating results. Further, management believes it is consistent with the basis by which investors analyze the Corporation&#146;s operating results given that freight and
	delivery revenues and costs represent pass-throughs and have no profit
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mark-up.
</FONT>
	Gross margin calculated as a percentage of total revenues represents the most directly comparable financial measure calculated in
	accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;).
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	EBITDA is a widely accepted financial indicator of a company&#146;s ability to service and/or incur
	indebtedness. EBITDA is not defined by GAAP and, as such, should not be construed as an alternative to net earnings or operating cash flow.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Adjusted consolidated earnings from operations and adjusted earnings per diluted share (&#147;Adjusted EPS&#148;) are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	measures which exclude the impact of TXI acquisition-related expenses, net; the impact of the markup of acquired inventory to fair value; and the gain or loss on business divestitures. The Corporation
	presents these measures to allow investors to analyze and forecast the Corporation&#146;s operating results given that these costs do not reflect the ongoing cost of its operations. These
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-GAAP
</FONT>
	measures are
	not necessarily comparable to similarly-titled measures used by other companies.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	Martin
	Marietta&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The average selling price per ton for the aggregates product line was $12.88, $12.00 and $11.12 for 2016, 2015 and
	2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016 and 2015, the average selling price increase exceeded the Corporation&#146;s average of 4.2% for both the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	ten-
</FONT>
	and twenty-year periods ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. The higher average selling price increase reflects supply and demand dynamics in the Corporation&#146;s markets. Average selling price increases in 2014
	were in line with historical averages.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following presents aggregates product line shipments for each reportable segment of the Aggregates
	business:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#0085CD">

<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION &amp; ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION &amp; RESULTS OF
	OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
	(continued)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" COLOR="#4D5358">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:24PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Shipments in 2016 and 2015 were negatively affected by wet weather, notably in the southwestern United
	States. Growth in 2016 was also hindered by certain infrastructure project delays, notably in Texas; a reduction in energy-sector shipments resulting from lower oil prices; and lower ballast shipments resulting from reduced activity on railroads.
	Aggregates product line volume strength in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Mid-America
</FONT>
	Group in 2016, relative to the other groups, is due to steady economic improvement, which is driving growth in office, retail, industrial and
	residential development in North Carolina and South Carolina.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Shipment growth in 2015 is primarily attributable to a full year of ownership of the
	legacy TXI aggregates operations, partially offset by the impact of historic levels of rainfall and a reduction in energy-sector shipments, notably for shale exploration. Shipment variances in 2015 for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Mid-America
</FONT>
	and Southeast Groups reflect the ongoing recovery in these markets, notably North Carolina, Georgia and Florida.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" COLOR="#49B28F">
<B>
<I>
	Aggregates-Related Downstream Operations.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Corporation&#146;s aggregates-related downstream operations include ready mixed concrete and asphalt and road paving businesses primarily located in the high-growth states of Texas and Colorado.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Average selling prices by product line for the Corporation&#146;s aggregates-related downstream operations are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
